Sequence Information.Peptide Name: TiAP (T. infestans antimicrobial protein, natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: the anterior midgut,Triatoma infestans, the main vector of Chagas disease

Literature.Author: Buarque DS, Gomes CM, Ara√∫jo RN, Pereira MH, Ferreira RC, Guarneri AA, Tanaka AS. 2016
Literature.Title: A new antimicrobial protein from the anterior midgut of Triatoma infestans mediates Trypanosoma cruzi establishment by controlling the microbiota

Sequence Information.Comments: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (30.4%) toHymenoptaecinGRAVY: -0.592; M Wt: 12164.864; Mol formula: C113H202N32O36S1; Mol ex coeff: 18675.Activity: Active against E. coli (MIC 1.2 uM) but not M.luteus.Proposed function: it plays a role in controling bacteira in microbiota to facilitate the parasite Trypanosoma cruzi establishment.
